column4: Hi there! Ive just installed ubuntu with alternative installer on my laptop. When I try to use the update manager, it wont download, but I got the laptop wired to the network... I cant choose another resolution than 800x600, how come?
i'd try to research resolution & your mobo
huh?
your graphics chipset just probably wsn't recognized and setup properly during installation
np, you can play w/ your X11 settings as well
apt-get doesn't work?
i'd give that a shot first
if you used an alternative installer, who knows what didn't come w/ it
sudo :)
try running it under root first, heh
you probably need to do: sudo apt-get update first
- what could be the problem?
it just fails when trying to download the pacages!!
ok, hten you got an internet connection issue :)
do you have internet access on that computer yet?
go into your shell, type in ping us.archive.ubuntu.com
from the terminal?
- yes I get an respons
ok, then try to run sudo apt-get update
if that doesn't work, install sources manually
- how do I do that?
did you get my PM?
